page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Site of old St Ebba's Chapel on Ebb's Neuk point,13th century chapel on site of 7th century chapel,damaged in 1940's,could be excavated. 16th century Pele Tower now part of 18th century Craster Arms. Bronze age sandstone cists discovered when camp site being built. Beadnell,earliest spelling Bedehall, 116l.O.E.Beda's halh-Bedar haugh. Millers Nick-cut in sand hills where the miller from Tughall Mill carted his sacks to Beadnell. Featherblow- A large sand hill which blew into the sea late 1800's. Windmillsteads - point where corn mill stood. Delf(Dell) Point - Delf meant quarry. Swinhoe - O.E. Swin-hoh- Swine hill. Tuggal -O.E. Tugga-healh -Tugga's haugh. Long Nanny Burn. - Celtic origin.
